title: Government Branches and the Constitution

vocab.definition: The supreme law of the United States that establishes our government
The part of government led by the President that enforces laws
The part of government (Congress) that makes laws
The part of government (courts) that interprets laws
A system where each branch of government can limit the others' power

teachingNotes: Explain how the three branches work together and check each other's power. Use examples of how laws are made, enforced, and interpreted.

sample.question: Which branch of government is led by the President?

truefalse.question: The Constitution is the supreme law of the United States.

multiplechoice.question: Which branch of government makes laws?

fillintheblank.question: The system that prevents any one branch from becoming too powerful is called ________ and ________.

shortanswer.question: What does the judicial branch do?
